titleStmt.title: E. P. Davis et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9112

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Carter County -- Sct
To his Excellency B. McGoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The under Signed Petitioners would respectfully represent to your Excellency that Jonithan Rogers was fined by the Carter Circuit Court ^April Term 1861^ the Sum of $20, as Charged for Liveing in with a woman and not being married Now Mr Rogers is a good Industrious citizen and a Poor Man; and we do not think that Said Rogers ought to be fined as Judgement went against him by default and he could not get a rehearing and we think if he had a fair trial he would not have been proved Gilty and we think under the circumstances and considering the hardness of the times think that he ought to be released and we as his neighbours petition your Excellency to remit Said fine and by so doing you will confer a great favor to an honest citizen of Said County and for such releif we Shall ever Pray

E P Davis
G. W. Dickerson
J B Welsh
Wesley Simpkins
B F Shepherd
C N Lewis
J B
Jos. M. Plummer
Richard P. Hyrne
Tommas Davis
John ArmStrong
